title: Detecting Trace Boron Doped in Tungsten Plates Using ToF-SIMS, Raman, and SEM
content: Doping a small amount of boron (B) can reduce recrystallization of tungsten (W) effectively [1, 2]; and it is beneficial for additive manufacturing (AM) of W by reducing the embrittling behavior at grain boundaries [3]. Therefore, B-doping can potentially offer benefits to a plasma facing component (PFC) performance when materials are applied in an extreme high temperature, high neutron irradiation conditions. However, determination of B in W can be challenging when only trace amount of B is used. In this work, we study 1) if B was incorporated into W plates using hot rolling; and 2) determine the quantity of B. Two plates are the subject of study, nominally having 0.1 at%B and 0.01 at%B, respectively. A control W plate with B was used as a reference.
